title: How to Make Raspberry Lime Bread

steps.headline: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt.
In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, egg, vanilla, vegetable oil and lime zest until smooth.
steps.description:
Stir in half of the flour mixture and all of the milk. Stir in the rest of the flour mixture until just combined. steps.headline: Bake for 1 hour at 350ºF / 180ºC, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the loaf comes out clean when it is removed.
Turn loaf out onto a wire rack and cool completely before slicing.
Store wrapped in plastic wrap and it will keep for several days.

text:
Preheat oven to 350ºF / 180ºC. Lightly grease the loaf pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, egg, vanilla, vegetable oil and lime zest until smooth. Stir in half of the flour mixture and all of the milk. Stir in the rest of the flour mixture until just combined. Stir in the raspberries and pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/74\/Make-Raspberry-Lime-Bread-Step-03.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Raspberry-Lime-Bread-Step-03.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/74\/Make-Raspberry-Lime-Bread-Step-03.jpg\/aid394563-v4-728px-Make-Raspberry-Lime-Bread-Step-03.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Bake for 1 hour at 350ºF / 180ºC, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the loaf comes out clean when it is removed. Turn loaf out onto a wire rack and cool completely before slicing. Store wrapped in plastic wrap and it will keep for several days.
